standard_metadata.standard_description: Recognize that in a multi-digit whole number, a digit in one place represents ten times what it represents in the place to its right.

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the right.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $2{,}900$ |$\searrow\goldD{2}$ | $\searrow\purpleD{9}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\greenD{0}$   $2{,}900 \div 10$ |$?$ |$?$ |$?$| $?$

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $2{,}900$ |$\searrow\goldD{2}$ | $\searrow\purpleD{9}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\greenD{\cancel0}$   $2{,}900 \div 10$ | |$\goldD{2}$ | $\purpleD{9}$ |$\blueD{0}$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift our numbers $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $2{,}900$| |$\swarrow\goldD{2}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{9}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $2{,}900 \times 10$ | $?$ | $?$ |$?$ | $?$ | $?$

Number | Ten Thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | :-:  $2{,}900$| |$\swarrow\goldD{2}$ | $\swarrow\purpleD{9}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $2{,}900 \times 10$ | $\goldD{2}$ | $\purpleD{9}$ |$\blueD{0}$ | $\greenD{0}$ | $0$
The answers:  $\begin{align} &\goldD2{,}\purpleD9\blueD0\greenD0 \div 10=\goldD2\purpleD9\blueD0 \\\\ &\goldD2{,}\purpleD9\blueD0\greenD0\times10=\goldD2\purpleD9{,}\blueD0\greenD00 \end{align}$
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the right.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $50$ |  | $\searrow\blueD{5}$ | $\searrow\greenD{0}$   $50 \div 10$ | |$?$| $?$
Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $50$ |  | $\searrow\blueD{5}$ | $\searrow\greenD{\cancel0}$   $50 \div 10$ | | | $\blueD{5}$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $50$ |  | $\swarrow\blueD{5}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $50 \times 10$ |$?$ |$?$| $?$
Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $50$ |  | $\swarrow\blueD{5}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $50 \times 10$ |$\blueD{5}$ |$\greenD{0}$| $0$
The answers:  $\begin{align} &\blueD5=\blueD5\greenD0 \div 10\\\\ &\blueD5\greenD00=\blueD5\greenD0\times10 \end{align}$

question.content: **Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**  $530= 53$   $10$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $530$ is one place to the left of the same digit in the number $53$.   Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $53$ | | $\swarrow\blueD{5}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{3}$   $530$ | $\blueD5$ |$\greenD3$ |$0$  Moving each digit to the left means multiplying by $10$:    $\blueD5\greenD30 = \blueD5\greenD3\times10$

question.content: **Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**     $79{,}200$  $10=7{,}920$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $7{,}920$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $79{,}200$.  Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-: $\searrow\goldD7$ | $\searrow\purpleD9$ | $\searrow\blueC2$ | $\searrow\greenD0$ |$\cancel0$  | $\goldD7$ | $\purpleD9$ | $\blueC2$ | $\greenD0$   Moving each digit of $79{,}200$ to the right means dividing by $10$:  $\goldD7\purpleD9{,}\blueD2\greenD00 \div 10  = \goldD7{,}\purpleD9\blueD2\greenD0$

question.content: **Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**     $2{,}500$  $250=10$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $250$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $2{,}500$.  Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-: $\searrow\goldD2$ | $\searrow\purpleD5$ | $\searrow\blueD0$ | $\cancel0$   | $\goldD2$ | $\purpleD5$ | $\blueD0$    Moving each digit of $2{,}500$ to the right means dividing by $10$:  $\goldD2{,}\purpleD5\blueD0\greenD0 \div 10 = \goldD2\purpleD5\blueD0$ so,  $\goldD2{,}\purpleD5\blueD0\greenD0 \div \goldD2\purpleD5\blueD0 = 10$

question.content: **Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**     $34{,}000$  $3{,}400=10$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $3{,}400$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $34{,}000$.  Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-: $\searrow\goldD3$ | $\searrow\purpleD4$ | $\searrow\blueC0$ | $\searrow\greenD0$ |$\cancel0$  | $\goldD3$ | $\purpleD4$ | $\blueC0$ | $\greenD0$   Moving each digit of $34{,}000$ to the right means dividing by $10$:  $\goldD3\purpleD4{,}\blueD0\greenD00 \div 10 = \goldD3{,}\purpleD4\blueD0\greenD0$ so,  $\goldD3\purpleD4{,}\blueD0\greenD00 \div \goldD3{,}\purpleD4\blueD0\greenD0 = 10$

question.content: **Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**    $8{,}610=861$     $10$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $8{,}610$ is one place to the left of the same digits in the number $861$.  Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:  | $\swarrow\purpleD8$ | $\swarrow\blueD6$ | $\swarrow\greenC1$  $\purpleD8$ | $\blueD6$ | $\greenC1$ | $0$  Moving each digit to the left means multiplying by $10$:  $\purpleD8{,}\blueD6\greenD10 = \purpleD8\blueD6\greenD1\times10$

question.content: **Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**    $476= 4{,}760$   $10$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $476$ is one place to the right of the same digits in the number $4{,}760$.  Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-: $\searrow\goldD4$ | $\searrow\purpleD7$ | $\searrow\blueD6$ | $\cancel0$   | $\goldD4$ | $\purpleD7$ | $\blueD6$    Moving each digit of $4{,}760$ to the right means dividing by $10$:  $\goldD4{,}\purpleD7\blueD6\greenD0 \div 10 = \goldD4\purpleD7\blueD6$ so,  $\goldD4\purpleD7\blueD6 = \goldD4{,}\purpleD7\blueD6\greenD0 \div 10$

question.content: **Which number makes the equation true?**  $\square=700 \div 70 $

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $70$ is one place to the right of the same digit in the number $700$.   Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $700$ |$\searrow\purpleD{7}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\cancel{0}$   $70$ | |$\purpleD7$ |$\blueD0$  Moving each digit to the right means dividing by $10$:    $\purpleD7\blueD00\div10=\purpleD7\blueD0$ so,     $\purpleD7\blueD00\div\purpleD7\blueD0=10$
$10=\purpleD7\blueD00\div\purpleD7\blueD0$

question.content: **Which number makes the equation true?**  $550 \div 55 = \square$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $55$ is one place to the right of the same digit in the number $550$.   Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $550$ |$\searrow\purpleD{5}$ | $\searrow\blueD{5}$ | $\searrow\cancel{0}$   $55$ | |$\purpleD5$ |$\blueD5$  Moving each digit to the right means dividing by $10$:    $\purpleD5\blueD50\div10=\purpleD5\blueD5$ so,     $\purpleD5\blueD50\div\purpleD5\blueD5=10$

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $80$ is one place to the right of the same digit in the number $800$.   Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $800$ |$\searrow\purpleD{8}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\greenD{0}$   $80$ | |$\purpleD8$ |$\blueD0$  Moving each digit to the right means dividing by $10$:    $\purpleD8\blueD00\div10=\purpleD8\blueD0$ so,     $\purpleD8\blueD00\div\purpleD8\blueD0=10$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |  :-: $80$| |  $\swarrow\blueD8$ |$\swarrow\greenD{0}$  $10 \times 80$| $\blueD8$ | $\greenD0$ | $0$  $10 \times \blueD{8}\greenD{0} =\blueD8\greenD00$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | $880$ | | $\swarrow\purpleD{8}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{8}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $880 \times 10$ | $\purpleD{8}$ |$\blueD{8}$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$  $\purpleD8\blueD8\greenD0 \times 10=\purpleD8{,}\blueD8\greenD00$
The answer:  Expression |Card - | - | - $800\div80$   | $10$ $10\times 80$ | $800$ $880\times 10$ | $8{,}800$

question.content: **Select true or false for each equation.**

hints.content: When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.  When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | $670$ | | $\swarrow\purpleD{6}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{7}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $670 \times 10$ | $\purpleD{6}$ |$\blueD{7}$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$  $\purpleD6\blueD7\greenD0 \times 10=\purpleD6{,}\blueD7\greenD00$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.  Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $70$| |$\swarrow\blueD{7}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$   $70 \times 10$ |$\blueD7$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$  $\blueD7\greenD0 \times 10=\blueD7\greenD00$

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the right.  Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $6{,}000$ |$\searrow\goldD{6}$ | $\searrow\purpleD{0}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\cancel0$   $6{,}000 \div 10$ | |$\goldD{6}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ |$\blueD{0}$  $\goldD6{,}\purpleD0\blueD0\greenD0 \div 10=\goldD6\purpleD0\blueD0$  So, $6{,}000 \div 10\neq 60$.
| True | False - | - | - $670 \times 10=6{,}700$ |  $\huge\bullet$ | $\huge\circ$  $70 \times 10=700$ | $\huge\bullet$ | $\huge\circ$  $6{,}000 \div 10=60$ | $\huge\circ$ | $\huge\bullet$
